page.title: 16Robert Winters. Part Four.
page.content: Robert is given seventy pence a week pocket money. He puts forty pence in the bank to save towards school trips and spends thirty pence at Morrisons. Morrisons is a big supermarket near Heapham that Robert's family call their local shop. They do most of their weekly shopping there. Robert enjoys living in a village but sometimes he gets rather bored because he lives such a long way from any friends. His mother told us that if they want to go to the cinema they have to travel to Lincoln. This takes a long time by bus and is expensive. A few weeks ago they went to see Ghostbusters. They caught the bus at five minutes past one and did not return home until half past six. The trip for two children, one adult and two ice-creams cost ten pounds and twenty pence.
